intro: Centaurea haradjianii, commonly known as the Haradjian's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its striking blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
